description: Equivalent of the Kurepa hypothesis for left factorial.
comments: a(n) = A002467(n)/(n-1) (A002467(n)=number of non-derangements of {1,2,...,n}). - _Emeric Deutsch_, Jun 15 2009
links: T. Kotek, J. A. Makowsky, Recurrence Relations for Graph Polynomials on Bi-iterative Families of Graphs, arXiv preprint arXiv:1309.4020, 2013
Romeo Mestrovic, Variations of Kurepa's left factorial hypothesis, arXiv preprint arXiv:1312.7037, 2013
Alexsandar Petojevic, The Function vM_m(s; a; z) and Some Well-Known Sequences, Journal of Integer Sequences, Vol. 5 (2002), Article 02.1.7
maple: a[2] := 1: a[3] := 2: for n from 4 to 21 do a[n] := (n-2)*a[n-1]+(n-3)*a[n-2] end do: seq(a[n], n = 2 .. 21); # _Emeric Deutsch_, Jun 15 2009
prog: (Sage) from sage.combinat.sloane_functions import ExtremesOfPermanentsSequence2 ; e = ExtremesOfPermanentsSequence2() ; it = e.gen(1,2,1) ; [it.next() for i in range(20)] #(5 rows) # _Zerinvary Lajos_, May 15 2009
